Delegation

Read more about it in this brilliant post by Jeremy Howard. > We will use it to provide the functionality of pd.DataFrame to our BaseFrame Model

A delegate is a person sent or authorized to represent others. To delegate means to entrust a task or responsibility to another person.

The delegates decorator takes the named arguments from one function and injects them into the signature of the function that is being decorated. This allows for auto-completion in a jupyter notebook and add doc string templates.

{% raw %}

delegates[source]

delegates(to=None, keep=False)

Decorator: replace **kwargs in signature with params from to

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

function_with_many_named_args(arg_1:str=None, arg_2:int=None, arg_3:date=None)

a description doc string

just_one_more[source]

just_one_more(extra, arg_1:str=None, arg_2:int=None, arg_3:date=None)

doc string from my delegate: function_with_many_named_args

a description doc string

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
from pydantic_pandas.core import BaseModel

class Record(BaseModel):
    string: str
    number: int
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
dummy_df(Record).info()
